What can I say.  This is the best game I've ever played!

Since I first played the Portal 2 singleplayer campaign about a month ago, I've been obsessed with this game and everything about it to the point where I've played it thrice: once to enjoy, once for the developer commentary, and once for achievements. The puzzles are incredibly well balanced and well paced (especially after playing Portal a few days prior)--I only truly felt stuck on the second Chamber 16 (which I later discovered had a commentary node explaining how the level was redesigned slightly because playtesters were more lost than I was on it). The story's writing is immaculate, featuring an incredible sense of humor and a very fun-to-follow plotline. The soundtrack is incredible, and I love the unique style each piece has. And this is all before mentioning the co-op campaign, which I'm certainly looking forward to finish with one of my friends.

I just love it. Portal 2 has quickly become one of my favorite games of all time, and it's let me craving more. More explanations for why Aperture Science followed the path it did (e.g. why the mainframe causes the central core to become a murderous megalomaniac). More puzzles with such finely tuned balance (tried the Portal: Reloaded mod and it is pure suffering in comparison to the learning curve in Portal 2). Just... more stuff to the point that I can't describe it. I haven't been able to find any other game that provides the unique puzzle solving, pacing, story, and overall experience Portal 2 provides, and I'm starving for more.

In short, (in my opinion) Portal 2 is one of the greatest games of all time--if not, THE greatest--and it's a title I'm proud to say it overwhelmingly deserves.
